title: Rams
notes: Don't need much to make an affecting film. Very sad.

title: Rosemary's Baby
notes: Hail Adrian! Cracking film - loved the way it took it's time.

title: Amadeus
notes: Impressive Oscar fair, but didn't really do it for me.

title: Ace in the Hole
notes: Kirk Douglas centre stage - where he likes to be, but good parable relevant as now as ever.

title: 10 Cloverfield Lane
notes: Decent bit of suspense. End felt a bit superfluous.

title: Out of Sight
notes: Enjoyable enough - thing about being cool, it's not cool to be cool. This was abit too cool.

title: Eyes Without a Face
notes: Very odd with strangely stylish bits - it is French after all.

title: The Thin Red Line
notes: Entrancing visuals and strong performances in an unconventional war movie.

title: The Wicker Man
notes: Bit Groovy, bit trippy, bit funny, bit creepy. Wish I'd seen it years ago.

title: Bull Durham
notes: Sports films need chemistry, as the formula is often the same. This one had it

title: Coach Carter
notes: Plenty of the usual sports cliches, elevated by Samuel L Jackson and a slightly unconventional angle.

title: Horns
notes: Started well, was fun and different, got gradually more clunky.

title: Eye in the Sky
notes: Superbly tense throughout and through-provoking. Proper thriller.

title: Trumbo
notes: Little ponderous at times, amused that Helen Mirren obviously gave up on the accent, enough there to keep me interested.
